slots.description: The slotted content is displayed if the context area  has no elements.
This slot is present if an error occurs during context area retrieval or loading of dependencies, together with setting error attribute on the polyfea-context element
slots.name: error

members.name: define
members.description: Defines the custom element 'polyfea-context' if not already defined *

members.name: contextName
members.description:
The name of the context area to load. Either `context-name` or `name` shall be set.
The property `context-name` takes priority if it is set

members.name: name
members.description:
The name of the context area to load. Either `context-name` or `name` shall be set.
The property `context-name` takes priority if it is set

members.name: take
members.description:
Specifies the number of context area elements to render.
If this property is unset or has a non-positive value, all configured
elements will be rendered.

members.name: extraAttributes
members.description: Defines additional attributes to be set on the rendered elements.

members.name: extraStyle
members.description: Additional style properties to be set on the rendered elements.

members.name: verbosity
members.description:
The verbosity level of the component.

- `silent`: No logs or warnings are produced.
- `error`: Only warnings about errors during context area loading are produced. This is the default level.
- `verbose`: Detailed logs about context area loading and microfrontend loading are produced.

The verbosity level can also be set globally using a meta tag in the document head:
`<meta name="polyfea.context-verbosity" content="silent|error|verbose">`

members.name: error
members.description:
If an error occurs during context area retrieval or loading of dependencies,
this attribute is set with the error message. Otherwise, it is null.

attributes.name: context-name
attributes.description:
The name of the context area to load. Either `context-name` or `name` shall be set.
The property `context-name` takes priority if it is set

attributes.name: name

The name of the context area to load. Either `context-name` or `name` shall be set.
The property `context-name` takes priority if it is set

If this property is unset or has a non-positive value, all configured
elements will be rendered.

attributes.description: Additional style properties to be set on the rendered elements.

attributes.name: verbosity

The verbosity level of the component.

- `silent`: No logs or warnings are produced.
- `error`: Only warnings about errors during context area loading are produced. This is the default level.
- `verbose`: Detailed logs about context area loading and microfrontend loading are produced.

The verbosity level can also be set globally using a meta tag in the document head:
`<meta name="polyfea.context-verbosity" content="silent|error|verbose">`

If an error occurs during context area retrieval or loading of dependencies,
this attribute is set with the error message. Otherwise, it is null.
